A question related to chromatic splitting

Jul 22, 2019

In this post, I would like to understand how certain elements featuring in the chromatic splitting conjecture relate to our elements . The chromatic splitting conjecture is a statement about the transchromatic component of the chromatic fracture square: one version of it says that the map admits a splitting, which exhibits as a wedge summand of . Another version of it goes as follows.

Define an element as follows. Let denote the Morava stabilizer group at height , and let denote the norm, where the final map is given by quotienting out by the subgroup of roots of unity. Then defines a class in ; composing with the inclusion of into (where is a Morava E-theory of height ) gives a class in . This class is a permanent cycle in the Morava spectral sequence, and therefore gives an element .

This class can be seen to be a permanent cycle by the following spectrum-level definition of : let denote the kernel of , and let be such that is a topological generator of . Then there is a fiber sequence

and the composite of the unit of with gives .

is an equivalence. One takeaway of this discussion is therefore that this is a pretty important element, and so we’d like to understand it better.

Notice, now, that is precisely the element that we’ve been interested in for a bunch of the past few posts.
